title: Darwin PBPK Platform: AI-Powered Pharmacokinetic Prediction
description: State-of-the-art deep learning platform for PBPK parameter prediction (fraction unbound, volume of distribution, clearance) using multi-modal molecular representations. Features ChemBERTa embeddings (768d), molecular graphs (PyTorch Geometric with 20 node and 7 edge features), and RDKit descriptors (25 features). Employs advanced GNN architectures (GAT + TransformerConv with 4 attention heads) and multi-task learning with weighted loss. Trained on 44,779 compounds from ChEMBL and Therapeutics Data Commons (TDC). Integrates PhysioQM physics-informed constraints for interpretable and physically-plausible predictions. Target performance: R² > 0.55 for clearance prediction, suitable for drug discovery pipelines and Nature-level publications.

creators.name: Agourakis, Demetrios Chiuratto
creators.affiliation: Pontifícia Universidade Católica do Rio Grande do Sul (PUCRS)

references: Therapeutics Data Commons (TDC): Machine learning datasets for drug discovery. Available at: https://tdcommons.ai
ChEMBL Database: Manually curated database of bioactive molecules with drug-like properties. Available at: https://www.ebi.ac.uk/chembl/
Chithrananda S, Grand G, Ramsundar B. ChemBERTa: Large-Scale Self-Supervised Pretraining for Molecular Property Prediction. arXiv:2010.09885; 2020.
